question.questionText: Katie got a guitar for her birthday. She experimented with the strings and found she could change their sounds. Katie also discovered that when she pressed down on a string with her finger, making the string shorter, the sound again changed. Describe how the sound was different when the string was shortened.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: When the string was shorter, the pitch was higher.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: It will not make loud pluck like the other strings.
If it was shorter it would have a low sound.
When you pluck the first string it makes a low pitch.
At first it would make noise slower than the shorter one because it would be shorter noise.
It was a higher pitch!
Which side has more string is a lower pitch. Whichever side has more string it has a lower pitch.
Because when you give it less room to vibrate it makes a higher pitch.
It got a higher pitch.
It is a high pitch.
A bigger string makes a lower pitch and a little string would have a high pitch.

It is going to be higher.
When it vibrates it goes so fast but it hits the string.
The pitch would be higher because the vibrations do not travel as long.
